responses: What can I do for you?

A disease in which abnormal cells divide uncontrollably and destroy body tissue. Some genetic changes causes cells to divide uncontrollably and provides ability to the cells to spread to other locations and destroys them.

When cells divide uncontrollably in Breast and have ability to spread outside the Breast to other organs and destory the surround tissue is called Breast Cancer. If not treated, it can spread and destroy important organs and cause death.

A tumor or lump is any abnormal mass of tissue or swelling. Like a cyst, a tumor can form in any part of the body. A tumor can be benign or cancerous (malignant), A benign tumor has distinct, smooth, regular borders. A malignant tumor has irregular borders and grows faster than a benign tumor. 
 A malignant tumor can also spread to other parts of your body. A benign tumor can become quite large, but it will not invade nearby tissue or spread to other parts of your body.

A cyst is a sac that may be filled with air, fluid or other material. A cyst can form in any part of the body, including bones, organs and soft tissues. Most cysts are noncancerous (benign), but sometimes cancer can cause a cyst.

patterns: What is Ductul carcinoma in situ
what us stage 0 cancer of Ducts?
responses: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast. DCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. DCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct.  However the cells can bcome invasive in due time can spread to other organs. Hence It should be treated by consulting a Oncologist/OncoSurgen. The positive news is that if you have only DCIS without Invasive componenet, the 10 year survival rate is 98%, however if you are diagonized  with DCIS, you will need fequent monitoring  even after treatment as your risk of cancer increases if you had DCIS.

patterns: What is Lobular carcinoma in situ
what us stage 0 cancer of Lobules?
responses: Lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk lobules in the breast. LCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. LCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct.  However the cells can bcome invasive in due time can spread to other organs. Hence It should be treated by consulting a Oncologist/OncoSurgen. The positive news is that if you have only LCIS without Invasive componenet, the 10 year survival rate is 98%, however if you are diagonized  with LCIS, you will need fequent monitoring  even after treatment as your risk of cancer increases if you had LCIS.

A biopsy is a procedure to remove a piece of tissue or a sample of cells from your body so that it can be tested in a laboratory. In Aspiration biopsy a syringe is inserted to draw out some cells and those cells are checked under microscope. In USG guided biosy an ultrasonography machine is used to check the tumor and a neddle is inserted to draw some pieces of tumor to analyze under microsope

patterns: Will I get cured of cancer
Is there a cure for cancer
responses: Breast Cancer at early stages can be cured in most of the cases. Even in advance stages, there are lots of treatment available, with the advancement in cancer treatment in recent years, patients can live a long life

patterns: Analyze my risk for Breast Cancer?
What are my chances to get breast cancer
Is Age a factor to get breast cancer?
responses: Anyone can get  Breast Cancer, however chances of getting Breast cancer are more if you or your first degree family memeber had history of Invasive or In situ Breast cancer

patterns: what is the treatment of cancer
what is the treatment of in-situ cancer
Is it mandatory to take chemo during cancer treatment?
For How long the cancer tereatment goes on
responses:
Surgery is the main form of treatment, if there is not much spread of cancer in body, Surgery will be done first(Mestactomy or Lumpactomy)
Followed by Chemotherapy and Radiation. Sometimes chemo and Radition will be given together. Sometimes Radition may not be given depending on age and type of cancer. In case of advance or stage 4 cases, Chemo is usually recommend before surgery

patterns: How many stages are there in cancer
responses:
If the cancer is in-situ with no invasive component its called stage 0 or precancer
If cancer is invasive that it as move to nearby breast tissue other than where it originated but has size less than 2 cm and not spread to other organs or lymp node its called stage 1.
If the cancer is more than 2 cm but not invaded lymp node and is invasive its called stage 2, if the cancer has invaded lymp node but not spread to other organs its called stage 3 and if the cancer has spread to other organs its called stage 4

patterns: What are my chances of surving breast cancer, will I survive breast cancer?, Breast cancer prognosis.
responses:
If caught early nearly 99% of Breast cancer can be cured, hence its very important to do Breast Checkups.
 If the cancer is localized 5-yrs survival rate is 99%/
If the cancer is regional and  spread to lymp node the survival rate is 86% and if the cancer is spread  to other organs the survival rate is 29%.
 The above figures do not distinguish between different type of Breast caners. The prognosis depends on cancer types as well.

patterns: What are hormone postive Breast cancer
What is ER PR postive cancer
What is ER PR negative cancer
responses: Cancer cells can have hormone receptors, that is hormones might fuel the growth of cancer cels, if there are Estrogen hormone receptor they are called ER Positive Cancers, if there are Progestrone hormone receptors they are called PR positive cancer, There are more treatment options available or ER/PR positive cancer and becaue of this these types of cancer have better prognosis when compared to ER/PR negative cancers
